item.title: has_geo_address
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of GeoCoordinates, GeoShape, Organization, Person, Place. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_address :: PostalAddress, Text ] or [ has_geo_address :: PostalAddress, Text ] Physical address of the item.

item.title: has_geo_area
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of BroadcastService. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_area :: Place ] or [ has_geo_area :: Place ] The area within which users can expect to reach the broadcast service.

item.title: has_geo_is_available_at_or_from
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of Demand, Offer. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_is_available_at_or_from :: Place ] or [ has_geo_available_at_or_from :: Place ] The place(s) from which the offer can be obtained (e.

item.title: has_geo_billing_address
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of Order. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_billing_address :: PostalAddress ] or [ has_geo_billing_address :: PostalAddress ] The billing address for the order.

item.title: has_geo_birth_place
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of Person. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_birth_place :: Place ] or [ has_geo_birth_place :: Place ] The place where the person was born.

item.title: has_geo_contained_in
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of Place. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_contained_in :: Place ] or [ has_geo_contained_in :: Place ] The basic containment relation between a place and one that contains it.

item.title: has_geo_contained_in_place
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of Place. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_contained_in_place :: Place ] or [ has_geo_contained_in_place :: Place ] The basic containment relation between a place and one that contains it.

item.title: has_geo_containing_place
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of Place. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_containing_place :: Place ] or [ has_geo_contains_place :: Place ] The basic containment relation between a place and another that it contains.

item.title: has_geo_content_location
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of CreativeWork. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_content_location :: Place ] or [ has_geo_content_location :: Place ] The location depicted or described in the content.

item.title: has_geo_course
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of ExerciseAction. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_course :: Place ] or [ has_geo_course :: Place ] A sub property of location.

item.title: has_geo_death_place
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of Person. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_death_place :: Place ] or [ has_geo_death_place :: Place ] The place where the person died.

item.title: has_geo_delivery_address
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of ParcelDelivery. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_delivery_address :: PostalAddress ] or [ has_geo_delivery_address :: PostalAddress ] Destination address.

item.title: has_geo_dropoff_location
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of RentalCarReservation. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_dropoff_location :: Place ] or [ has_geo_dropoff_location :: Place ] Where a rental car can be dropped off.

item.title: has_geo_eligible_region
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of ActionAccessSpecification, DeliveryChargeSpecification, Demand, Offer. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_eligible_region :: GeoShape, Place, Text ] or [ has_geo_eligible_region :: GeoShape, Place, Text ] The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is valid.

item.title: has_geo_exercise_course
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of ExerciseAction. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_exercise_course :: Place ] or [ has_geo_exercise_course :: Place ] A sub property of location.

item.title: has_geo_founding_location
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of Organization. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_founding_location :: Place ] or [ has_geo_founding_location :: Place ] The place where the Organization was founded.

item.title: has_geo_from_location
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of ExerciseAction, MoveAction, TransferAction. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_from_location :: Place ] or [ has_geo_from_location :: Place ] A sub property of location.

item.title: has_geo_game_location
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of Game, VideoGameSeries. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_game_location :: Place, PostalAddress, URL ] or [ has_geo_game_location :: Place, PostalAddress, URL ] Real or fictional location of the game (or part of game).

item.title: has_geo_place
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of Place. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_place :: GeoCoordinates, GeoShape ] or [ has_geo_geo :: GeoCoordinates, GeoShape ] The geo coordinates of the place.

item.title: has_geo_that_contains
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of GeospatialGeometry, Place. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_that_contains :: GeospatialGeometry, Place ] or [ has_geo_geo_contains :: GeospatialGeometry, Place ] Represents a relationship between two geometries (or the places they represent), relating a containing geometry to a contained geometry.

item.title: has_geo_covered_by
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of GeospatialGeometry, Place. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_covered_by :: GeospatialGeometry, Place ] or [ has_geo_geo_covered_by :: GeospatialGeometry, Place ] Represents a relationship between two geometries (or the places they represent), relating a geometry to another that covers it.

item.title: has_geo_that_covers
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of GeospatialGeometry, Place. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_that_covers :: GeospatialGeometry, Place ] or [ has_geo_geo_covers :: GeospatialGeometry, Place ] Represents a relationship between two geometries (or the places they represent), relating a covering geometry to a covered geometry.

item.title: has_geo_crossing
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of GeospatialGeometry, Place. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_crossing :: GeospatialGeometry, Place ] or [ has_geo_geo_crosses :: GeospatialGeometry, Place ] Represents a relationship between two geometries (or the places they represent), relating a geometry to another that crosses it: "a crosses b: they have some but not all interior points in common, and the dimension of the intersection is less than that of at least one of them".

item.title: has_geo_disjoint_with
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of GeospatialGeometry, Place. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_disjoint_with :: GeospatialGeometry, Place ] or [ has_geo_geo_disjoint :: GeospatialGeometry, Place ] Represents spatial relations in which two geometries (or the places they represent) are topologically disjoint: "they have no point in common.

item.title: has_geo_equal_to
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of GeospatialGeometry, Place. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_equal_to :: GeospatialGeometry, Place ] or [ has_geo_geo_equals :: GeospatialGeometry, Place ] Represents spatial relations in which two geometries (or the places they represent) are topologically equal, as defined in <a href="https://en.

item.title: has_geo_that_intersects
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of GeospatialGeometry, Place. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_that_intersects :: GeospatialGeometry, Place ] or [ has_geo_geo_intersects :: GeospatialGeometry, Place ] Represents spatial relations in which two geometries (or the places they represent) have at least one point in common.

item.title: has_geo_midpoint
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of GeoCircle. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_midpoint :: GeoCoordinates ] or [ has_geo_geo_midpoint :: GeoCoordinates ] Indicates the GeoCoordinates at the centre of a GeoShape, e.

item.title: has_geo_that_overlaps
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of GeospatialGeometry, Place. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_that_overlaps :: GeospatialGeometry, Place ] or [ has_geo_geo_overlaps :: GeospatialGeometry, Place ] Represents a relationship between two geometries (or the places they represent), relating a geometry to another that geospatially overlaps it, i.

item.title: has_geo_that_touches
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of GeospatialGeometry, Place. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_that_touches :: GeospatialGeometry, Place ] or [ has_geo_geo_touches :: GeospatialGeometry, Place ] Represents spatial relations in which two geometries (or the places they represent) touch: "they have at least one boundary point in common, but no interior points.

item.title: has_geo_within
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of GeospatialGeometry, Place. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_within :: GeospatialGeometry, Place ] or [ has_geo_geo_within :: GeospatialGeometry, Place ] Represents a relationship between two geometries (or the places they represent), relating a geometry to one that contains it, i.

item.title: has_geo_POS
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of Organization, Person. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_POS :: Place ] or [ has_geo_has_POS :: Place ] Points-of-Sales operated by the organization or person.

item.title: has_geo_ineligible_region
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of ActionAccessSpecification, DeliveryChargeSpecification, Demand, MediaObject, Offer. [ #is_/part_of :: pending: ] Use it like this:

item.title: has_geo_item_location
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of ArchiveComponent. [ #is_/part_of :: pending: ] Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_item_location :: Place, PostalAddress, Text ] or [ has_geo_item_location :: Place, PostalAddress, Text ] Current location of the item.

item.title: has_geo_job_location
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of JobPosting. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_job_location :: Place ] or [ has_geo_job_location :: Place ] A (typically single) geographic location associated with the job position.

item.title: has_geo_location
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of Action, Event, InteractionCounter, Organization. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_location :: Place, PostalAddress, Text, VirtualLocation ] or [ has_geo_location :: Place, PostalAddress, Text, VirtualLocation ] The location of, for example, where an event is happening, where an organization is located, or where an action takes place.

item.title: has_geo_location_created
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of CreativeWork. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_location_created :: Place ] or [ has_geo_location_created :: Place ] The location where the CreativeWork was created, which may not be the same as the location depicted in the CreativeWork.

item.title: has_geo_origin_address
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of ParcelDelivery. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_origin_address :: PostalAddress ] or [ has_geo_origin_address :: PostalAddress ] Shipper's address.

item.title: has_geo_pickup_location
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of RentalCarReservation, TaxiReservation. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_pickup_location :: Place ] or [ has_geo_pickup_location :: Place ] Where a taxi will pick up a passenger or a rental car can be picked up.

item.title: has_geo_postal_code_range
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of DefinedRegion. [ #is_/part_of :: pending: ] Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_postal_code_range :: PostalCodeRangeSpecification ] or [ has_geo_postal_code_range :: PostalCodeRangeSpecification ] A defined range of postal codes.

item.title: has_geo_regions_allowed
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of MediaObject. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_regions_allowed :: Place ] or [ has_geo_regions_allowed :: Place ] The regions where the media is allowed.

item.title: has_geo_service_location
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of ServiceChannel. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_service_location :: Place ] or [ has_geo_service_location :: Place ] The location (e.

item.title: has_geo_service_postal_address
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of ServiceChannel. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_service_postal_address :: PostalAddress ] or [ has_geo_service_postal_address :: PostalAddress ] The address for accessing the service by mail.

item.title: has_geo_spatial
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of CreativeWork. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_spatial :: Place ] or [ has_geo_spatial :: Place ] The "spatial" property can be used in cases when more specific properties (e.

item.title: has_geo_spatial_coverage
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of CreativeWork. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_spatial_coverage :: Place ] or [ has_geo_spatial_coverage :: Place ] The spatialCoverage of a CreativeWork indicates the place(s) which are the focus of the content.

item.title: has_geo_to_location
item.description: Predicate to describe the geo of ExerciseAction, InsertAction, MoveAction, TransferAction. Use it like this: [ #has_/geo/_to_location :: Place ] or [ has_geo_to_location :: Place ] A sub property of location.
